definitions.definition: To give permission , power , or the legal right to do something.
To give someone more confidence and/or strength to do something, often by enabling them to increase their control over their own life or situation.
examples: John found that starting up his own business empowered him greatly in social situations.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To give permission , power , or the legal right to do something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To give someone more confidence and/or strength to do something, often by enabling them to increase their control over their own life or situation.
